title: Issue 47 container confusion troubleshooting
details:
**Issue 47 Scenarios - Container Isolation Behavior:**

When testing Scenarios 1 & 2 (cross-tab sync), users may accidentally switch to tabs in different Firefox containers. This causes Quick Tabs to NOT appear, which is the CORRECT behavior per container isolation (Scenario 8).

**How to identify this issue:**
1. Console logs show `No data found for container firefox-container-X`
2. Quick Tab was created in `firefox-default` but user switched to tabs in `firefox-container-N`

**Root cause of confusion:**
- Firefox containers are invisible to most users
- Tabs can be in different containers without the user realizing it
- Container tabs have colored top borders, but this is subtle

**User guidance for proper testing:**
1. For cross-tab sync (Scenarios 1-2): Ensure ALL tabs are in the SAME container (typically `firefox-default`)
2. For container isolation (Scenario 8): Intentionally use different containers (Personal, Work, etc.)

**Technical background:**
- Each Firefox container has a unique `cookieStoreId` (e.g., `firefox-default`, `firefox-container-1`, etc.)
- Quick Tabs are stored per-container in the background script's `globalQuickTabState`
- Container isolation is enforced via `cookieStoreId` filtering in all state operations
